questiontext.text: A researcher wants to know whether there is more litter in the Netherlands than in Germany. The variable ‘litter’ is measured by the amount of litter per m2. A t-test is used for this study. What is the null hypothesis of this research?

generalfeedback.text:
There is no difference in the average amount of litter between the Netherlands and Germany.
H0       Mean Netherlands= Mean Germany
The alternative hypothesis is that there is a difference in the average amount of litter between the Netherlands and Germany, more in the Netherlands than in Germany in this example.
Ha    Mean Netherlands  >   Mean Germany

Language
Nederlands

Levels of Difficulty
Easy

M&T BIS
Default value

M&T Hypothesis testing: means
Default value

answer.text: The average amount of litter in both the Netherlands and Germany is 0.
There is a difference in the average amount of litter between the Netherlands and Germany.
There is no difference in the average amount of litter between the Netherlands and Germany.
The average amount of litter in the samples of both the Netherlands and Germany is unknown.
